content:
Yes, there are many examples of small events or decisions that had a significant impact on history. 

For example, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in 1914 was a seemingly small event, but it triggered World War I, which had a massive impact on the world.  

Another example is the decision by Rosa Parks to refuse to give up her seat on a bus in Montgomery, Alabama, in 1955. Her act of defiance sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott and became a symbol of the civil rights movement in the United States. 

In science and technology, small discoveries or inventions have led to major breakthroughs. Penicillin, for instance, which was discovered by accident by Alexander Fleming in 1928, revolutionized the treatment of infectious diseases. 

These are just a few examples of how seemingly small events or decisions can have an enormous impact on the course of history.
